+Thugs Bunny Same. I never want to see that war arc again. It was godawful. 
Its only saving grace was the kakashi vs obito fight (these guys should 
have been the main protagonists) but, sadly, the rest was either filled 
with exposition, sasuke, or was just plain awful. Madara being god tier, 
kaguya showing up, sakura STILL loving sasuke, and completely throwing out 
strategy. Fuck this arc. Part 2 of naruto was pretty average to begin with 
on my opinion (except the pain arc. I thought it was the best arc in naruto 
actually...not saying much though....) but this arc takes it to new lows.

Bleach is just......sigh.... being bleach. The arrancar arc was laughably 
bad and it just dragged and I thought the soul society arc, while not as 
bad, had elements of what bleach would turn out to be. Everyone's saying 
how the thousand year blood war arc is a step up for bleach but no its 
freaking awful. Granted, I think ichigo developed decently....I 
guess.....but his backstory just reeks of kubo just making it all up. Plus 
kubo had a decent idea to make everyone lose their bankais so I was hoping 
for them to learn how to use their normal forms. But kubo made them all 
lose their bankais in stupid ways and they became completely useless. 
Apparently renji's bankai is more important than byakuya's (his is stronger 
than renji's).

And I don't think too highly of dbz, but GT is just.....ew.....so terrible.

+Ryochi Mayeabara Agreed. I absolutely hated the *Fourth Soft Shinobi War 
Arc of cheesy speeches and corny ass power-ups.* I would rather watch the 
fucking *BUU SAGA* from DBZ, which initiated GT, than touch that "War" arc 
from Naruto ever again. The writing was on some GT-level of bullshittery. 

Bleach was better when it was trying to emulate YuYu Hakusho, but after the 
Soul Society Saga ended it went straight down the drain of shit by 
imitating DBZ, taking one of the *WORST* aspects of Z - that being my 
Reiatsu is bigger than yours, so you cannot hurt me. I win - and centring 
itself around it for years.

+DXFan619 Lol Bleach. Would have been the worst of the big 3 if not for the 
horribly written Ninja War Arc in Naruto. Meteors, Asspulls, shitty 
development are abundant in that last arc that almost deserves a "Rest in 
Piss" rating (key word: almost)

I think that Bleach should have stayed in the slice-of-life shonen action 
tone of its first few chapters. I found it better off (not saying 
much...this is a shonen after all) staying in that kind of set-up instead 
of these poorly-written dragged out arcs. 

I'm not too knowledgeable on One Piece but it ACTUALLY has foreshadowing 
(Lots of it. a rarity for shonen) and surprisingly does world building well 
(I agree with the people saying that sometimes it can get fucking 
ridiculous, but the worldbuilding is....actually not bad.). As many flaws 
that I can find in it (and there are quite a bit actually. Good arcs taking 
too long to reach, the sheer length of it, Luffy being a cliche shonen 
protagonist (despite being one of the better examples he's mostly a cliche 
hero who only cares about his friends), etc.), I feel that it kinda does 
deserve the spot as the best of the big three. I wouldn't say its the best 
shonen (I say its either HxH or FMA:Brotherhood) but it is better than the 
piles of shit-tier shonen I've been seeing lately.
also 100% accurate on the campaign of cod ghost

+DraconisMarchVII Very true about FMA. I found myself disliking (feels 
weird to say I dislike anything about FMA) the end of it, more specifically 
the fight with Father as I felt it delved way too far into shonen troupes. 
With that said, FMA at its worst still shits all over stuff like Bleach. 
Even beyond Fairy Tail, I think Bleach is the worst offender of style > 
substance. I do admit it looks great, but there's absolutely nothing going 
on, or if there is, it's terrible.

+DXFan619Revisited FMA is in a league of its own when it comes to shounen, 
though.  But the only problems I've found with it are ones that stem from 
the fact that it's still [unfortunately] a shounen.

Haha, I definitely have. Shame is, the shonen genre can actually be done 
very efficiently (see Fullmetal Alchemist), but most mangaka just don't 
give a shit, or don't have the writing chops to pull off a good story with 
good characters.

Powering up using friendship is as fucking stupid as the Maka winning 
through the power of "bravery". Speaking of Soul Eater, I would say that 
it's in fact worse than Fairy Tail. Don't get me wrong, I hate both series- 
they do nothing but blatantly pander to boob and action obsessed boys and 
man-children. They are the Michael Bay films of anime. 

Anyway, getting back to my point - Fairy Tail at least attempts to keep the 
plot coherent and has some semi-decent characters who actually show 
development. Soul Eater lacks all those things, and more. It is a trifecta 
of terrible; shit characters, messy plot and painfully bad writing. What 
makes this especially disappointing is how good Soul Eater could've been- 
the premise is interesting and the visual style of the anime is wonderfully 
unique. In these respects Soul Eater stands head and shoulders above Fairy 
Tail. Unfortnately, everything else lets it down.﻿

First of all I want to agree to your analysis of the film. The Characters 
are stereotypical and one dimensional, the plot is just a frame to embed 
the series of fights in, that the protagonists always win at the end, style 
always trumpes logic and emotions run high all the time. So, why do so many 
people obviously enjoy this stuff?

My answer to this question is rather easy:
Because of the series of fights, embedded in a shallow plot, which is 
always won with style by the stereotypical, one dimensional protagonists 
(after they lost the first "rounds") while running high on emotion. In 
other words: People watch this kind of series and movies, because they want 
to consume the emotions without the nuisance of a complex plot or long 
character introductions.

What I don't understand: Why are you so upset about it? I have seen a bunch 
of movies and episodes (not limited to anime) that I disliked, too. But I 
never felt a rage as you have expressed in this video.﻿

As long as you don't take it too serious, it's fine. By the way, if you 
think the movie has too little story and too much fanservice, then don't 
even start the OVAs...

The rage is typically exaggerated for entertainment purposes, but usually, 
this is how I feel about stuff like this.

I can see why you hate Fairy Tail, but come on dude, don't hate on all 
Shounen stuff. For one, One Piece is debatably the best manga series today 
right now. And while Bleach did a horrible job with plot, and could have 
gone in a better direction, Naruto is still one of the greatest out there.

As far as good guys always winning, I can't wrap my head around why you're 
making it seem like that's a "Shounen" thing, fiction itself always does 
it, the only ones, (especially anime) that don't do it are very VERY rare 
exceptions.

Naruto had a deep story line, and while like always, you know the good guys 
will win, the one thing we never knew was, "how are we gonna end all of 
this violence and chaos in the Shinobi world?" Naruto had characters that 
were loved and hated by many, but it's plot was by far it's strongest 
point, and it had a story not like most others at its time, and in many 
Shounen tittles you don't know how things are gonna play out, and the good 
guys don't win every battle, that's the case in all Shounen Anime/Manga.


Of course there're cliches, but come on, I don't think I can get a single 
anime genre in history that doesn't have cliches, and that statement is the 
same for anything in fiction. As far as keeping people entertained, and 
making the viewer feel like their in a long memorable journey, I'd have to 
say that Shounen Anime/Manga does the best job.﻿

1:38 - 2:10 = Why I love hxh
1. Too cliche: HxH generally doesn't follow the cliche patterns of every 
other shonen. I would say the only cliche thing in HxH is the happy go 
lucky main character, altough that heavily changes in one arc.
2. No characterization: HxH has the most character development I have seen 
from a shonen series, by far.
3. Hero always wins: The "Hero" of hxh, gon freecs, only won one fight over 
the entire series.
4. Aspulls: The way you gain power in hxh is based on reality, you have to 
train hard to gain more power, which is why the 2 main protagonists are 
constantly training in almost every arc which doesn't leave much room for 
asspulls.
5. Romance: Well ok, there are not many romantic parts over the series but 
it wouldn't be a shonen if it would be dripping with romance.
6. Over 9000 fights: The fights are very strategic and don't always make 
the stronger one but the one with the better tactics come out victorious.
7. Predictable plot: The Plot is just briliant and often leaves you with 
your mouth wide open, especially the 5th and 7th arc.﻿

you're not pointing out actual problems with the movie and just narrating 
the things that happen, sometimes with an angry voice as if you're implying 
there's something wrong with the scene. It doesn't matter how obvious the 
problem with the scene is, if you won't provide commentary on the scene

main problem. While you explained why you don't like most of the characters 
in Fairy Tail you just flat out said you hate Natsu without explaining why.

+Zelnyair Friendship is one of the major themes of Fairy Tail, and to be 
honest, the writters are REALLY pushy with it sometimes, with annoying 
cringey friendship speeches appearing often throughout the show (and yeah, 
some enemies get beaten down along with the speech, but it's not as bad as 
people tend to say, i can only think of 2 moments where truly went "ow 
comon, that was bullshit, he shouldn't have won that" ).

including some of my favorite scenes and characters in practically any

pretty damn good. So, in the end, it's just sorta Ok, entertaining to watch 
anime, suffering from being incredibly inconsistent. It's worth watching 
for me.

"Ok, so I just think you're a hater on things."
--So somebody giving their opinion on a work of fiction that they didn't 
find to be very good a hater now?  

"You think the thought of feelings is shit."
--You can start making sense now.  Anger is a feeling.  

"Well, I think you never experienced the bond of having friends."
--I hate Fairy Tail, yet love anime, and I still have a very active social 
life.  I just don't find Fairy Tail to be as good as people make it out to 
be, it's very predictable.

"Each Shounen show has their own way of a plot."
--Yeah, but very often the plot goes SIGNIFICANTLY downhill to the realm of 
repetitiveness and predictability.  This is not true for all shounens, as 
some of my favorite animes/mangas are shounens like Shigeki no Kyojin, 
Death Note, Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood and DBZ.  DBZ is a prime 
example of a shounen going downhill as DBZ is entertaining and compelling 
until the Buu saga.  Everything before that is pure gold.

"If you think the movie is horrible then why don't you tell that to Hiro 
Mashima yourself then."
--He may be a nice chap, but Fairy Tail is highly predictable, and because 
of that, I can't be entertained by it.  

"From what I can tell most of your videos has a bunch of hate."
--The OP does have videos of stuff he likes, like for example his review of 
Ghost in the Shell and Baccano.  And if you think he's blindly hating on 
the video games he hates, I DARE YOU to actually play them.  Seriously, 
play Shaq Fu and try to tell me he's just blindly hating on that game. 
 Play Bubsy 3D and Cheetahmen and try to tell us they're great games, 
because they are some of the worst games that exist on this planet.  While 
I will admit that liking an anime is largely a matter of opinion and 
perspective, I will agree that SAO, School Days and Mars of Destruction are 
awful.  Mostly because I find them to be poorly written, and poorly 
executed.

"In my opinion, you're just a loner hating on this show just 'cause there's 
friendship in this."
--How does a person's social life have any bearing on whether or not 
they'll like Fairy Tail?  Personally, I find the friendships in Fairy Tail 
to be one dimensional compared to reality.  Compared to Guts's and 
Griffith's friendship in Berserk, Fairy Tail's way of handling 
relationships is unrealistic. 

"Shounen shows may go downhill, but they do teach you something important 
in life."
--The problem is the first half of this sentence.  Not all shounen are like 
this, and Fairy Tail, Naruto, One Piece, Bleach, etc. all go downhill very 
fast after an interesting plot point is dealt with.  Not to mention the 
aforementioned works all copy tropes that Dragon Ball revolutionized anime 
with.  

"Anyways, if you hate Shounen shows then why are you watching them."
--Just because we hate Fairy Tail doesn't mean we hate anime that are 
shounen.  For example, some of favorite animes are Shingeki no Kyojin, 
Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, Death Note, and DBZ.  Please don't over 
generalize.  The OP may have said that IN GENERAL most shounen are bad, but 
that's not to say all shounen are bad.

"That goes out to you. It's your fault all your hatred is inside of you, so 
by you watching the show it's just pointless. Just watch what you enjoy and 
leave the others alone!"
--So if it's a work of fiction you like that somehow protects it from any 
criticism?  You know that's bloody stupid.  If you genuinely like the 
anime, that's fine, but we just tend to find it boring and predictable 
compared to other anime within the shounen demographic that are just better 
in terms of art and storytelling.

OKAY. There are 2 different kinds of people here: The first kind (And most 
dominant) is the "Art Critics" and the less spoken of (This is the category 
I fall into) is the "Enjoy Its". So the Art Critics point of view is 
expressed in this video, they think that shonen like Fairy Tail is of poor 
quality, cliche etc. but at the end of the day does that really matter? 
They critique things like if it were still art, but the major difference 
between still art and animation is that still art isn't made for your 
enjoyment but instead for expression of an individual. While animation, tv 
shows and movie's are mostly made for the entertainment purposes. So I want 
to ask why people are criticizing an anime like a piece of still art, why 
are you pointing out all those things many rarely even notice or care 
about? I feel like maybe not this movie but other shonen anime really do 
their job well and that mean entertaining their audience. Maybe Fairy Tail 
is too cheesy and lame for many of you but when it comes to the actual 
audience maybe it touches them? This IS intended for a younger audience 
after all so I think all of you critiquing this anime like if it were a bad 
piece of art are absolutely wrong, I would compare it to a professional 
adult critiquing a kids show like Dora The Explorer. But that's just my 
opinion and own personal perspective. ﻿

You gave your opinion. I shall give you mine. Fairy Tail has a plot. Fan 
service exists in every single anime, not just in Fairy Tail, saying the 
fan service consists of the entire plot is merely a lie. There is tons of 
character development, there was an entire season dedicated to Erza's past. 
Natsu and the dragon slayers pasts have been explained. Gray's past, 
personality, everything is explained. Lucy is explained. Even the villains. 
I will give you this, there are certain minor characters that are mentioned 
once or twice and then completely forgotten. The manga hasn't even ended 
and still, Hiiro is digging deeper into their lives even though we have all 
we need to know. The plot doesn't have one major goal like Naruto or One 
Piece. Hence their titles are based on the main goal (Naruto wants to 
become Hokage hence Naruto-since the goal is about him and One piece is 
about... finding the one piece). Fairy Tail is about different goals that 
each character wishes to achieve through the guild. Natsu wants to find his 
father as do the other dragon slayers. This is the major plotline-What 
happened to the dragons? Zeref is a huge plot line, he is basically the 
Satan of Earthland. Lucy wants to get all the keys and become stronger. 
What is Fairy Tail's darkest secret (hinted by Makarov and others in the 
anime) Unlike normal anime, the plot isn't straight up given to you, it 
develops overtime, giving you hints and clues which keeps us interested. It 
is tied up between each memeber's wishes. That's why it is not called 
dragon Slayer or Zeref or Natsu because it is based off of FAIRY TAIL's 
goals. Not just one.

You can dislike Fairy Tail. I'm not trying to persuade you to watch it. I 
am just trying to clear the air with the things you say that are not 
true-at least in my view. You tend to "hate" on popular anime which makes 
me think you mostly dislike them for that purpose... because they are 
"popular." I could be wrong but pulling the same thing as "plot" with no 
real evidence or only consists of "fan service" (which there is a lot but 
its minor compared to the plot) out of your ass sounds more of a regular 
thing people say when they truly have no reason to dislike it besides the 
fact that everyone loves it and they think its annoying just because its 
such a huge thing.

I'm just commenting as I watch the video. Shonen is really more of a 
demographic to me than a genre, as what mostly indicates it is the magazine 
the manga runs in or the particular timeslot the anime airs. While I 
don't think that shonen in general are bad, as there are too many out there 
that I've not seen and when I watch a show, I tend to not care what 
demographics they're aimed at, I unfortunately agree that from what I've 
seen so far, not many anime movies that are based off of anime shows are 
good.

I'm rather confused on whether or not Natsu is the protagonist, as the 
series tends to put more focus around the other members. While there is 
plot within the arcs, I agree that Fairy Tail gets too carried away with 
fan service. I think the underdeveloped characters con could've at least 
been alleviated if Hiro Mashima either took more time to explore the other 
characters before focusing on Team Natsu or made Fairy Tail a smaller 
guild. Not really looking forward to the friendship power up when I get to 
it.

tried anything.

get away with showing nothing but fanservice.

I respect that you have your own opinion, but I have to say I disagree. You 
don't seem to understand the whole purpose and meaning of Fairy Tail. Fairy 
Tail is about friends and love, which is something you obviously haven't 
experienced enough to understand its beauty. You look at the picture 
entirely, but you are too careless to look at the important details. 
Honestly, I feel sorry for you that you wasted 20 minutes of your free time 
just to bicker about how much Fairy Tail sucks according to you. What 
difference does it make? You can't stop the anime, so honestly I wouldn't 
waste my time if I were you. If you hate something, its common sense to try 
and forget about it, is it not? I swear I feel like you'd be the type of 
person to waste more time on things you hate rather than things you 
cherish. Fairy Tail is about love and how no matter what anyone goes 
through, they all stick together, and no one gets left behind. I haven't 
finished all of the Fairy Tail series, I'm in fact on episode 82 right now. 
I am not angry with your opinion, because you did in fact warn Fairy Tail 
fans to not watch this, and I'm not trying to change your opinion. I just 
want you to see that if you payed attention, and actually watched it and 
not criticize it based on non-important things, you might be surprised to 
find yourself enjoying it. I haven't experienced many animes yet, but I 
can't imagine any anime better than Fairy Tail. You say that everyone is 
"fucking annoying"? Well I find your bickering annoying, but I'm not making 
a 20 minute long video about it, am I? I understand you don't like things, 
I don't either, but this is one of the most childish things I've ever seen. 
You poor thing. You don't like something? Get over it. I'm actually jealous 
you have this much free time to make videos about hating on things! But 
then again, I'd rather spend that time with friends and watching Fairy 
Tail. :) I've come to realize that most haters of Fairy Tail lack strong 
feelings. I know it sounds stupid, but honestly I find it true. Most people 
that lack strong feelings hate on people that don't lack it. "Ooohhh Juvia 
wants the D..." "Ohhh Juvia is very fucking annoying!" These words are 
careless and stupid as hell. Juvia is in love. Yeah LOVE. Perhaps you've 
heard of it? Fairy Tail isn't our world, so you can't really compare it all 
that much despite that there are humans there. That's basically it. So 
saying that Eclair could be a cereal killer is iffy. In the world of Fairy 
Tail, enemies most times look the way they are. But even if they don't, 
Lucy is a kind hearted girl who wants to give help to Eclair. Plus, after 
all the guild has been through, I'm pretty sure they could easily take her 
down. Fairy Tail is about the deep stuff, which only the fans of it can 
understand and relate to. I'm honestly sorry you can't enjoy Fairy Tail, 
because I guarantee it is a truly amazing anime in my opinion, and I think 
if you just gave it a chance and really tried hard enough to seek into its 
true meaning, then you would possibly change your mind. Well anyway, enough 
of my ranting. I'm going to watch more Fairy Tail now. I fully support 
Fairy Tail, and honestly, if the haters would just calm down for a second 
and realize the true beauty of Fairy Tail, I think they would support just 
as much, if not- more than me. ^-^ <3 Nothing personal about this, just a 
simple disagreement. That's all. Have fun with hating! ^.^ /﻿

episodes.

Ah, so it's more shit that tries to be intelligent, but fails miserably. I 
thought literally all of Sword Art Online was a complete travesty, apart 
from the animation, and I usually tend to be forgiving on that stuff. 

But yeah, I think I get your take on things now, and something tells me you 
would REALLY hate Kill La Kill lol

+Hex PLAYS Good analysis, but it's a tad off the mark. I don't mind things 
without substance, honestly. I'm capable of having a fun time with things 
that are just mindless entertainment, like say Deadman Wonderland or 
Kekkaishi. That stuff is pretty simple, and I enjoyed it. What I can't 
stand is generally stuff that doesn't make sense, which is highly prevalent 
in most shonen. And on that note, I strongly disliked Ergo Proxy, which has 
a lot of depth, or at least attempted to. I don't think I'm predisposed to 
liking things with depth due to that. I like to judge everything on its own 
merit.

And with that said, just because I give a rating of a 5/10 or a 4/10 
doesn't mean I disliked it, it just means I don't think it was written well 
enough to deserve anything more, but I may have had a fun time watching it.

In terms of Code Geass, I don't think it has anything resembling a decent 
story, or likable characters, for that matter. I think it tends to suffer 
from many cliches, as does Gurren Lagann. 

I enjoyed reading your comment :)

much depth in it. It explains why you hate stuff like Gurren Laghann or 
most Shonen. Alot of other people can get past alot of that stuff more 
easily, and that's why alot of your videos have a lot of dislikes. However, 
I respect opinions as long as they arent flat out wrong, or insulting, and 
always could see reviews from your side. 

Personally, I can really enjoy plain stupid fun like Gurren Laghann or Code 
Geass, but as long as it at least tells a halfway decent story, and has 
likeable characters despite all the cliches.

+Etherious Spritesu The real question is: "How will Natsu's character 
change from this experience?" Sure, he might have some sort of motivation 
to hurt whoever killed his dragon. Fine, whatever, this only may last an 
arc or two. I'm sure Natsu's character will return status quo right after 
the arc ends and will probably never be mentioned again, rendering this 
whole story arc worthless. Obviously, this is all speculation, however, if 
they treat this arc like they did with the arc with Loke, I can guarantee 
it will be shit.

+Bilzardman Recently Fairy Tail has had major character development however 
it is futile telling you since I doubt you actually read it let alone try 
watching it. If Natsu trying to find his father Igneel changing into 
wanting to avenge his fathers death and having to leave his friends to go 
train for a year so that he can get stronger to accomplish his goal is not 
character development then I don't know what is.

+Gouri Saini Oh, goody, I get to break apart someone's comment. This should 
be fun. You mentioned how Fairy Tail has emotions. I hate to break it to 
you, however, Fairy tail does not have ANY character development, thus 
making the wonderful sad scenes pretty damn bad. Now, let me say this: 
Giving someone a power up is NOT character development. A change in goals, 
personality, beliefs, things similar to that is character development. Does 
one of those friendship speeches ever change Lucy's character other than 
wanting to dig (deeper) into Natsu's pants? Also, the fights are, well, 
they are pretty bad. They lack intensity. There are far to many fights with 
atrocious villains that make you wonder why the hell are they fighting in 
the first place. And friendship speeches are pretty bad. And I think it is 
worth mentioning that I did not bitch about how the story was executed. One 
of my favorites, Samurai Champloo, does not really have a story. (Sure, it 
has an objective, but not really a story.) I'm glad Fairy Tail means so 
much to you, I really am. Continue to love the shit out of the series. 
However, if you look at it critically, this is just another fighting shonen 
that will die out in popularity just like Katekyo Hitman Reborn did once it 
ends.
